result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank James Kopetko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof, if requested by his agent.

records.addlTxt: Copy of check #8912 in the amount of $250.00 issued to Mike Kopetko for refund of bond
DNA Notification and Proof of Submission

Case called at 10:26 AM. Defendant Frank James Kopetko in court with attorney Kelly Mattingly.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is Resolved.  Defendant withdraws plea of not guilty.  Attorney Mattingly files Plea and Waiver form.  Guilty plea Count 1, sentence withheld-probation for 12 months with conditions.  COurt questions Defendant regarding Plea and Waiver.  Court questions Attorney Mattingly regarding his client's plea and waiver.  Factual Basis-criminal complaint.  Court finds plea is made freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently.  State moves for joint recommendation of parties.  Attorney Mattingly concurs with State.  Defendant makes statement to the Court.  The Court grants motion of parties, sentence withheld probation 12 months with conditions.
Status conference on December 12, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 9:14 AM.
Defendant Frank James Kopetko in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant stands "MUTE"
Court enters "NOT GUILTY" plea.
DDI filed.  Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Def. posted on Sat. 10/29/16.  Def. still resides at 7841 Carr Factory Rd., Cuba City, WI.  Def. has copy of complaint.  Court finds probable cause for diling. 
Signature bond set at $1,000.00.  No conditions.  Def. plans to contact an attorney.  Set for AIA on 11/14/16.

case called at 9:23 AM.
Defendant Frank James Kopetko not in court.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves for $250 Warrant
Court finds probable cause for filing.
Court grants states request $250.00 bond amount.
